Who else wants to get escorted to the front of the airport security line? Amex Plat gives you airport lounge access, CLEAR membership, and Global Entry. Amex also does instant approvals, so you do not have to wait for your card to come in the mail to use it. Here’s ⬇️ how I make $792 off my Amex Plat card that also gives me airport lounge access. 

Feel free to go to my link in bio or comment #AmexPlat if you would like to a referral for #americanexpressplatinum. You might be targeted for either a 80,000-150,000 sign up bonus if you spend $6,000 in 6 months ($695 annual fee).

This card has credits for CLEAR (which has someone escort you to the front of the airport security line) and Global Entry. If you apply for Global Entry it will only also include TSA PreCheck. You just need your Amex Plat card to pay and you will get reimbursed in full on your credit card bill. 

Most airport lounges allow you to enter with a same day ticket within 3 hours of departure and the credit card that gives you access (such as, Priority Pass or Amex Plat). Thus, you can save on save on food and drinks at the #airportlounge .

Please note, you need to either have Priority Pass or the credit card needed to get into the lounge. For example, if you show your #amexplatinum card you can also get access to Centurion Lounge, Escape Lounges, Delta Sky Club (must fly Delta same day), Plaza Premium, and Air Space. Priority Pass will not give you access to any of these lounges.

Save 🔖this post for my favorite card to use for airport lounge access, airline incidental credits, and 5x on flights booked directly with airlines! This card also has trip cancellation, trip interruption, and trip delay insurance that can cover flight cancellations (check the Amex website for more details).

Here’s the Amex Plat credits ⬇️ I actually use $ $1,487 credits

$189 CLEAR
$200 Uber credit
$100 Saks
$200 Hotel credit
$200 airline incidental credit
$150 Corporate Advantage Program credit
20,000 points + $150 retention
$98 Walmart+
-$695 Annual Fee
$792 Money Maker

Amex Plat also gives gold status for Marriott and Hilton.

Feel free to send this post to a friend 👭 if you find this helpful! Thanks!

Please do not wait until Tuesday, 12/6/22 to apply for any Southwest credit cards! The 75K offer is ending tomorrow on Monday! Here’s ⬇️ more details on how you can just get 2 Southwest credit cards to get companion pass, and bring a friend on flights for free + $5.60 taxes each way.

Comment #SW2for1 to get a list of Southwest (SW) Credit Cards and steps on how to get #southwestcompanionpass .

#SouthwestAirlines Companion Pass is very valuable because this is essentially a #buyonegetone offer. If you buy one ticket with points or cash, your friend that comes with you only needs to pay for taxes. You can also change your companion up to three times each calendar year that you have Companion Pass. Please note, for #CompanionPass your companion cannot fly without you. You must be on the flight.

The faster way to get Companion Pass is to get both a SW personal and SW business card. 

I would apply for a personal SW card now because the offer is ending on Monday. I do not know when the 75K offer will come back, and the 75K points helps you dramatically on reaching companion pass. Here ⬇️ are the steps I would do.

Please note, you must be 5/24 at the time of application, which means in theory you opened 4 credit card max in the past 24 months. Capital One, TD, and Discover business credit cards count towards 5/24. If you are applying for both cards the same day, apply for the business card first and then the personal card.

1. Personal SW credit card (Southwest Rapid Rewards Plus Credit Card-75K sign up bonus)

2. Business SW credit card (Southwest Rapid Rewards Premier Business Credit Card, 60K sign up bonus) 

With these two sign up bonuses, you would have enough points (75K + 60K = 135K) to get a companion pass if you meet the minimum spending requirement. You can sign up for the Southwest credit cards now, but wait until Monday, 1/2/23  onwards to finish  the spending requirement to get the Southwest Companion Pass until Tuesday, 12/31/24!

You can also get SW points from referrals, the Rapid Rewards Dining, Rapid Rewards Shopping or with Southwest’s hotel, rental car, and travel partners that can go towards the 135,000 points needed for Companion Pass.

Who else wishes that each airport lounge had a sleeping lounge? If you have a layover or early flight this can be very handy instead of paying for a hotel. Here’s ⬇️ how to get access to priority pass with credit cards.

Feel free to comment #prioritypass for a master list of credit cards that have priority pass #airportlounges access. The example below is for the Capital One Venture X card that has Priority Pass access and that is also a $5 money maker.

This is at the sleep ‘n fly airport lounge at #Doha #hamadinternationalairport ( #DOH ), and you can use a credit card that Priority Pass to enter and sleep for free.

Save 🔖 this post as an example of how travel #creditcards easily pay for themselves with their benefits, so you do not have to pay more to travel!

#capitalonecreditcard Venture X has a lot of credits that will make this #creditcard an easy $5 money maker. With the sign up bonus, this will be at least $755 in value. Here’s ⬇️the details.

Earn 75,000 bonus miles once you spend $4,000 on purchases within your first 3 months.

$395 Annual Fee - $300 Annual Travel Credit - $100 Anniversary = $5 Profit Maker

With this card there is complimentary unlimited #loungeaccess for cardholders, authorized users and up to two guests per visit to #CapitalOne Lounges and to more than 1,300 #prioritypasslounge (no restaurants starting 1/1/23) worldwide.

Each authorized user with Priority Pass can bring themselves, and 2 guests to enter for free! At this time, there is no minimum age requirement to add a user to Capital One, and you can add up to 4 users on the Capital One website. In addition, you can only add users at the same address. Please note, I would add only people you trust to your credit cards.

This card also gives authorized users Trip delay and lost baggage coverage and the primary auto rental collision damage waiver (CDW) coverage for car rentals (check the Capital One website for more details).

Also get at least 2x on everything.

Authorized users do not get
1) $300 travel credit
2) TSA/Global Entry credit
3) 10,000 anniversary bonus miles

Feel free to send this post to a friend 👭 if you find this helpful! Thanks!

Who else likes to eat food from around the world? I think one of the best parts of traveling is trying food from different countries. You get to know a culture through food and see how different countries do things.  Here’s ⬇️ one of my favorite dishes in Gdansk,  Poland and how you can easily get 3x dining and pay no foreign transaction fees with a no annual fee credit card.

You can easily find pierogi in Gdansk, and I was lucky to eat some on a boat ride , @familiabistro , and at @pierogarniamandu ! I did have to detox afterwards with a green smoothie at @smooththefruit because the food was delicious, but also heavy .

Save 🔖 this post as a friendly reminder to eat at any of the restaurants listed above in #gdansk and to use a credit card that does not charge foreign transaction fees abroad. Credit cards were accepted almost everywhere in #gdańsk .

If you want a list of the top #creditcards to use for dining comment #diningcreditcards . Capital One SavorOne Cash Rewards would be my top choice if you want a credit card with no annual fees, no foreign transaction fees, and a free Uber One membership to save on Uber until 11/14/24. You also get 10x Uber/Uber Eats, 3x dining/grocery stores, and the option to move to points to Capital One Venture/X.

In Gdansk, Poland one of the must have things to eat is pierogi. A #pierogi is a European-styled dumpling that is made out of thicker dough (compared to Chinese potstickers). In addition, instead of soy sauce you usually eat #pierogies with sour cream, Greek yogurt or cottage cheese, melted butter, fried onions or pork rinds. Popular pierogi include  meat, cheese, sauerkraut, potatoes, and fruits. I would say a Polish pierogi is bigger than a Chinese dumpling, but unlike Empanadas it is not made from ground beef/chicken and corn dough.

Isn’t it great how each country makes #dumplings so different and delicious? 

#gdanskpoland #polandtravel #polandtravelplanner #polandtravels #WITSGdansk #VisitGdansk #LetsMeetGdansk #gdanskcity
#polishdumplings #allithinkaboutisfood

If you are not stacking then you leaving money on the table! In this reel you saw how you can easily use a portal, credit card offer, and sale to save money on a monitor! $320 is a lot of money and 9K points can get you a one way ticket. You can use British Airways to book AA flights starting at 7,500 points + $5.60 one way.  Don’t you want to save money and get points to book a flight from a purchase you were going to make anyway? Here’s ⬇️ how to get started.

Save 🔖 this post to learn how to be #bougieonabudget and stack to save more money.

1. Portal - Type in the name of the website in Cashbackmonitor.com to see if there are any options to get cash back or miles back on your purchase. Common portals are Rakuten and TopCashBack.

2. Credit Card Offers - Check your credits cards Cit, Capital One, Amex, and Chase if you can activate a coupon for the merchant on the bank app

3. Promo code/coupon - Use internet browser extensions Honey or Capital One Shopping to see if there are any promo codes for the store.

4. 3rd party apps - Common apps are Fetch (to scan the receipt), Coupons.com and ibotta.

5. Card linked offers - Link your credit card number to the app to get automatic discounts

6. Credit Card Category Spend - Use the credit card that has the highest return on category spend for the merchant

I like to use Rakuten to get Amex points instead of cash back. With Amex points you can transfer your points to 17 airline ✈️and 3 hotel programs to travel for free.

Feel free to DM ✍️me or go to my link in bio if you are interested in any credit cards. My favorite Amex card is Amex Gold because   4x U.S Supermarkets (up to $25,000) 🍎 and 4x Global Restaurants, and I made $390 off this card. If you are interested in the Amex Gold card you will get 60,000- 90,000 points if you spend $4,000 in 6 months.

Amex Gold 💳 Math

$120 dining (Grubhub, Seamless, Boxed & some participating restaurants)
$120 Uber/Uber Eats
$100 Amex Corporate Advantage Program
-$250 Annual fee
-$300 Amex Retention Offer (30,000 points)

$120 + $120 + $100 -$250 - $300= $390 💰 money maker.

Feel free to SEND this post to a 👭 friend if you find it helpful!

The key to finding award space is being flexible! Book either super early when award space comes out or last minute for your flight! I found this business class ticket 19 days before departure. I paid only $107.75 to fly in business class instead of $2,684 in a lie flat seat. Here’s ⬇️ how.

Save 🔖 this post as an example of a #QatarAirways redemption. You can be #bougieonabudget and use British Airways to book Qatar flights with points if you find availability. Transfer Blue Bank, American Express, and Capital One #creditcardpoints to BA. BA releases award space 355 days in advance.

I paid for my Qatar flight with my #AmericanExpressPlatinum card because I get 5x points for flights booked directly with airlines. Even though, Amex Plat has as $695 annual fee the fact that I can book a flight that is worth $2,684 with points from this card makes it worthwhile. I also make $792 off my Amex Plat card.

I did taxes at $.01 per point, since you can cash out Amex points for gift cards (please don’t do this). This is for math purposes to calculate the value!

Retail price for Qatar #businessclassseat was $2,684 USD, but instead it was $107.75 USD and 43,000 British Airways Avios. If we do the cost per point analysis, this would have been ($2,684+ $107.75)/(43,000+10,775) at $.05. This is from DOH to DUB one way. You can book a roundtrip flight from DOH to DUB if you get the Amex Plat sign up bonus.

Do not delay! The 80,000 sign up offer on Citi Premier is ending soon! You do not want to miss out!

Comment #80Koffer to learn more about this card. This card has a $95 annual fee and you need to spend $4,000 in 3 months to get the 80,000 sign up bonus bonus.

Not all credit cards have high sign up bonuses, and sometimes they can drop. In the past, this card has been at 60K, which is a 20K difference! For perspective, I can use Avianca/Turkish to book a United flight for 7,500 points each way + $5.60+ taxes in the USA each way, so not doing this sign up bonus can easily cost you almost 3 one way flights to go somewhere!

Or this can cost me up to almost a week for a Choice Hotel stay if I did not get the 80K sign up bonus! Choice Hotels is a 2:1 ratio, so for every 1,000 points transferred = 2,000 points to Choice. Choice Hotel redemption range from 6,000-35,000 points per night. Therefore, if you find a 6,000 points property then you can just transfer 3,000 Citi points to book it due to the 2:1 ratio. So, if you missed out on the 80,000 points sign up bonus and waited to apply at 60,000 points, then you let 40,000 points go (since Choice is 2:1). That can easily cost you 1 night at a Choice Hotel up to almost a week just for delaying on applying for this card and not getting the high sign up offer!

For this card you will get 3x on the below:

3x
gas 
supermarkets 
restaurants
airfare
hotels

This is a great card if you spend in any of those categories because there is no limit for how much you can earn 3x for.

Some of my favorite airline transfer partners on this card are Choice Hotels, Avianca/Turkish (for United flights), Air France/KLM and Virgin Atlantic (for Delta flights), and Cathay Pacific for (OneWorld).

Feel free to share this post with a friend thanks!

Do not miss out on this card!

Did you know some hotels let you check in early? I’m team red eye and I do early hotel checkin or drop off my bags at the hotel and explore! I got lucky and I was not charged an early check-in fee! And I took a red eye flight and landed early in the morning! And my hotel had free breakfast! Depending on the hotel you can do early check-in and/or a lot of times they will will also let you drop off your bags for free at the bellman, so depends what you want to do. Here’s ⬇️ more details on how to save more on hotels with points.

Comment hotelblue for more details about the Hyatt credit cards that you can use to book this hotel.

If you are a Hyatt credit cardmember you can earn 1,000 Bonus Points per stay at Hyatt House and Hyatt Place hotels if you stay a minimum of 2 nights between 1/2/23 and 3/5/23. Register by 1/31/23  and then stay by 3/5/23.

This was at the Hyatt Place Chicago Itasca. I took a red eye and landed early and I got lucky the lady did not charge me a fee to check in early! She also picked me up from a free shuttle from another hotel ! From the video they usually do depending on your status.

Save 🔖 this post as a reminder that you can use Hyatt points to book this ! Hyatt has a personal credit card and business credit card and you can get both cards to stack points. You can also use blue bank cards to transfer points to Hyatt to get even more points to book. All these credit cards have at least a 60,000 sign up bonus if you spend between $4,000 - $15,000 in 3 months. Annual fees for these credit cards range from $95-$550. Feel free to go to my link in profile or DM me if you want a referral for any credit cards.

Find availability on the Hyatt website and you can use the “Points Calendar” feature to see how much points will cost for different times of the year. This Hyatt place hotel was category 1 and only 5,000 points per night!

Our expenses would have been a lot higher if it was not for the free breakfast. It was free with points because we did it the bougie on a budget way and had free break fast!

Feel free to share this post with a friend if you find this helpful!

Do you or do you not check in bags? I usually do not, but because my personal item was full I ended up checking in my backpack and using my tote bag. Here’s how ⬇️ I ended up getting a $235 travel credit on JetBlue for a delayed bag.

I bought a #basiceconomy ticket on Jetblue, which means I am suppose to be personal item only, and no carry on bag allowed. The cost for a checked bag on JetBlue is $35 for the first bag, $45 for a second bag, and $150 for any bag after that. However, since I have #AmericanAirlines Platinum Pro status, and JetBlue and AA have reciprocal benefits, I was able to check in my bag for free! With my #AAstatus , I get 2 free #checkedbag on JetBlue, and no carry on. A carry on fee at the gate is $65, so yes I checked in a bag instead for free!

However, my checked bag ended up getting stuck in Orlando and JetBlue offered me a $35 travel credit. I had an option to either expense toiletries ($25 per day, $100 max for 5 days depending on when your bag comes). However, the travel credit is higher and is $50 for #delayedluggage for 1-23 hours, $100 for 24-47 hours, $150 for 48-71 hours, and $200 for 72+ hours. The airline also delivers your bag to your house.

My travel credit was suppose to be only $100 but I told #JetBlue about the inconvenience of the delayed flight and how I ended up taking an Uber to go home because there were no more public transit buses running, and they gave me an extra $100! This brought my total to $235 for the travel credit!

I do recommend getting an #airlinecreditcard if you #checkedbag often, since most airlines have it included for free. However, if you do not check in bags often you are better off with a travel credit card because they have stronger travel protections. Some blue bank credits cards #delayedbaggage and cover you $100 per day for up to five days (kicks in after 6+ hours). However, my $550 blue bank #creditcard would not work in this situation because it does not cover when your destination is your permanent residence.

If you are curious about #creditcards , feel free to comment “bluebank” and I can send you a master list of credit cards that earn points for this blue bank.

Who else does not want to pay foreign transaction fees when traveling? If you are not ready to get an annual fee credit card just yet, your next solution is is to get a no annual fee credit card to avoid foreign transaction fees. Here’s ⬇️ more details.

Comment #noforeignfees to learn how Capital One does not charge #foreigntransactionfees for any card.

Capital One Savor One and Capital One VentureOne do not have annual fees and you can get cash back on these purchases! You can earn $200 back when you spend $500 within your first 3 months for each card.

Capital One Savor One will get you 3% dining, 3% streaming, 3% entertainment, and 3% grocery stores. So, if you will be eating a lot abroad, consider getting the #CapitalOne Savor One card. You can get #cashback or save your Capital One cash in the meantime and move them to Capital One Venture X (once you are ready to apply and get this card) to build up your travel fund.

This card also has 10% back on qualifying purchases on Uber and Uber Eats plus complimentary Uber One membership, through November 14, 2024.

Capital One VentureOne will get you 1.25x everything. Sign up offer is not as good as Capital One Venture X ($395 annual fee), but it still gives you the option to transfer your miles to Capital One partners. You can always apply and get a sign up bonus for Capital One Venture X card later.

It is much better to get a #creditcard that does not have foreign transaction fees than to keep using a credit card that charges it! Especially because foreign transaction fees can easily be 3% for each purchase! So wouldn’t you rather get 3% back from Capital One Savor One card than to be charged 3% for the foreign transaction fees?

For me I use Capital One Venture X ($395 annual fee, $5 money maker after credits) when I’m abroad because I get 2x on everything and travel protections but if you are not ready to get this credit card yet then your next best step is to avoid foreign transaction fees entirely.

Feel free to go to my link in bio or DM ✍️ if you would like a referral link for these credit cards. Thanks!

This is how a travel hacker travels by knowing how to use credit card benefits and using American Airlines status.You can learn how by also following @pennywisetraveler for more money/travel tips. Here’s  details on how I did it for my trip to the Bahamas.

Flight - Used Amex Plat card for 5x airlines to buy a basic economy ticket for $391.15 roundtrip from LAX- NAS. Cost for flying an economy ticket was 15,000-19,500 points each way + $7 in taxes. Since redemption was not that good, I decided to risk getting a complimentary upgrade with my American Airlines Platinum Pro status, which means I would have to pay cash for a ticket vs using miles.

Got upgraded 3 times to fly first/biz for my flights to the Bahamas! My AA Plat Pro status gives complimentary upgrades on cash tickets if they are available! I got first on LAX - MIA, business on MIA - NAS, business on NAS - MIA, and premium economy MIA - LAX. I paid cash for this flight because redemption with points and miles was not this great.

American Express Platinum #creditcard - This credit card has airport lounge access, which includes Graycliff Divans (Priority Pass lounge), which I ate here for breakfast (NAS - MIA segment). I used this card to go to the Centurion Lounge at MIA for my layover (MIA - LAX) and got a free massage (tip $5)  and ate lunch.

Dinner - Since I got upgraded to business class for my NAS - MIA segment that means I can go to the American Airlines Admirals Club Lounge, so I went here for dinner when I landed at LAX. My flight from MIA - LAX was packed, so I was not able to get upgraded to first class, but was still able to get upgraded from basic economy to premium economy.

Be responsible and use up your existing travel credits and credit card points before signing up for more credit cards. Otherwise your existing credit cards will cost you money because you are not using them! Here’s ⬇️ more details.

Follow @pennywisetraveler for more money/travel tips.

I sat in the back of the airplane on United and this flight was packed! Instead of paying for a flight on American Airlines I decided to use  my United Travel Bank credits. United Travel Bank credits are valid for every 5 years, but given that it was already unused for 2 years, I did not want more years to swing by! This flight was also cheaper on United vs American.

So yes, I used United Travel Bank instead of paying money for an American Airlines flight that I possibly would have got upgraded on because I have American Airlines Platinum Pro status!  I do not have status with United and decided not to status match my American Airlines Platinum Pro status to United Premier Platinum because you can only do it every 5 years, and I only had 2 flights scheduled for United this year, and did not want to waste it for 2 flights.

Too often we get so caught up in getting a better seat with airline status or another high credit card sign up bonus that we do not use the current travel credits and points that we currently do have.

Before you sign up for the next #creditcard try to see if you have a goal in mind to use the points! Or evaluate if you can make money off the credit card with the features and perks on the credit card! Otherwise you are just sitting on points and miles and the credit card will cost you money for not using it!

Yes, you can just apply for 1 credit card that has an annual fee of $69+ and get Southwest Companion Pass until 2/28/24. Here’s ⬇️ more details on how to get companion pass, and bring a friend on flights for free + $5.60 taxes each way.

Comment #SW2for1 to get a list of Southwest (SW) Credit Cards and steps on how to get #southwestcompanionpass .

You need to apply for 1 Southwest Personal #CreditCard (Plus, Premier, or Priority). These #creditcards annual fees range from $69-149, and you just need 1 of these credit card for this offer.

Earn Companion Pass through 2/28/2024 plus 30,000 points after you spend $4,000 on purchases in the first 3 months from account opening. Offer ends Monday, 3/13/23. 

Promotional Companion Pass valid through 2/28/2024.

#SouthwestAirlines Companion Pass is very valuable because this is essentially a #buyonegetone offer. If you buy one ticket with points or cash, your friend that comes with you only needs to pay for taxes. You can also change your companion up to three times each calendar year that you have Companion Pass. Please note, for #CompanionPass your companion cannot fly without you. You must be on the flight.

Please note, you must be 5/24 at the time of application, which means in theory you opened 4 credit card max in the past 24 months. Capital One, TD, and Discover business credit cards count towards 5/24. If you are applying for both cards the same day, apply for the business card first and then the personal card.

In the past to get Companion Pass you need either 2 Southwest business cards or 1 business and 1 personal credit card and get at least 135,000 points. You can also earn SW points from referrals, the Rapid Rewards Dining, Rapid Rewards Shopping or with Southwest’s hotel, rental car, and travel partner.s Not everyone can do that, so this offer is good if you do not have a business or do not want to sign up for multiple credit cards. It is more points with the old method (since higher sign up bonuses), but this offer is great if you just want to apply for 1 credit card.

The 90,000 biz 💳 card sign up offers are ending soon! Comment “bizcard” to learn more. You do not need a traditional small business or LLC to get a business credit card! Here’s ⬇️ how to apply and qualify for the 90,000 credit card sign up offers.

Do not wait past this weekend to apply! Go to my link in bio or comment “bizcard” to get a link for these credit cards. Get 90,000 points on each of the cards if you spend $6,000 in your first 3 months of account opening.

Your #Sidehustle is considered a  #soleproprietorship , which makes you eligible for business credit cards. #Sidehustles examples include consulting, driving for Uber, delivering food on Doordash, and selling things on eBay or Craigslist.

Here ⬇️ are steps on how to apply as a #soleproprietor.

1) Your business name is your own name. For example, if your name is David John Smith on your personal #creditcards then you can put David John Smith as your name and put David John Smith as your Business name. If you do not have a middle name, and you name is David Smith, then it would be David Smith as your name and David Smith as your Business Name.

2)Your Tax ID Number is your Social Security Number

3) Your business income is the amount you will be earning/estimating from your side income

Do not make up a business name. If you do it can void your application.

Please note, I am also not your financial advisor, and this content is for informational purposes only. Thanks!

Who else uses T-Mobile data when traveling abroad? Before buying a SIM card I usually check the T-Mobile website to see if there is free unlimited data roaming in that country, so I can make free calls and free texts through an app like WhatsApp instead. Here’s ⬇️ more details.

Comment “cellinsurance” if you want a master list of #creditcards that have cellphone insurance.

T-Mobile has up to 5GB of high-speed data in 215+ countries & destinations if you have a Magenta MAX or Plus plan. Instead of paying $.25/minute for calls, I will make the phone call through WhatsApp, Instagram, or Facebook Messenger if I need to contact a friend while traveling. If you make a phone call through your phone it will literally charge $.25/minute vs if you call someone through an app like WhatsApp, Instagram or Facebook Messenger it will be free, since it is using data instead!

So if a country isn’t listed on the T-Mobile website, I will buy a SIM card, and if the country is listed on the T-Mobile website for international roaming then I won’t and save money, since I can just turn on data roaming on my phone.

Even better if I make the phone call through WhatsApp/Instagram/Facebook Messenger on WiFi, since it will not take up any data, and still be free.

I used T-Mobile data in Japan and it was pretty much good for the most part. The data coverage was pretty seamless, and I didn’t really have issues using the internet. I did buy an eSIM card as backup though.

In case something happens to your cellphone, I would  recommend paying your cellphone bill with a credit card that has cellphone insurance. If you use the Blue Bank Ink Preferred Card ($95 annual fee) then you will also get 3x on your phone bill and it has cellphone insurance baked in. If you are looking for a no annual fee option the Blue Bank Freedom Flex is a good option with cellphone insurance baked in. You must pay for your cellphone bill with the #creditcard though for it to count. 

Comment “cellinsurance” if you want a master list of credit cards that have cellphone insurance.

Who else had a ✈️ flight delayed and have been forced to stay longer on vacation? Some credit cards have trip delay insurance built into the credit card, which is helpful if you are stuck somewhere for 12+ hours and/or if you stay overnight. Here’s ⬇️ details.

Comment “tripdelay” or DM me for a sample list of #creditcards that have trip delay insurance.These annual #creditcard fees range from $95-$695. The sign up bonuses also range from 30,000-150,000 points. The only card that is no annual fee with trip delay insurance is Marriott Bonvoy Bold.

United Club Infinite
#AmericanExpressPlatinum

Depending on the credit card, trip delay protection will kick in if a common carrier (bus, cruise trip, airplane, and train) delays you by more than 6 hours -12 hours or if you have to stay overnight. The trip has to be for a city away from your residence and less than 365 days in length. Trip delay insurance will help cover expenses while you wait. Expenses include food, transportation, overnight accommodation, toiletries, and medication.

Please note, trip delay insurance will not work if you oversleep or get stuck in traffic.

Please read the fine print for details for your credit card coverage. Coverage is usually up to $500 per covered trip and up to two claims per 12-month period per card. Coverage can only extend to the people traveling with you like your spouse, and dependent children up to age 19 or 26 if full time student.

Please note, coverage is only provided on round-trip travel purchased entirely with that eligible card (paying taxes and fees on award tickets should count) for Amex vs blue bank you can book one way. Trip delay coverage from your credit card will kick in after you use up your frequent flyer/third party insurance. To file a claim call your credit card.

What’s better than a window seat? Getting a lie flat seat on an airplane! A lie flat seat is essentially a bed on an airplane. Here’s how ⬇️ I booked this flight.

I like flying business/first class for international flights to help with jet lag. This flight was close to 12 hours, so it helped having a bed and blanket to sleep and extra legroom. This is extremely helpful if you want to reduce the chance of getting jet lag and being up and ready when you get to your destination.

I was able to book a first class flight on #JapanAirlines from Tokyo to Los Angeles. I used 80,000 AA miles and paid $46.95 taxes.  Retail price for this flight was $12,690. Flight was in the first class JAL Suite on a Boeing777-300ER (773).

Cost per mile for this flight was $.16 ($12,690/80,000) which is a very good redemption without taxes. Cost per mile with taxes at $.01 (if I cashed out at $.01 but I don’t recommend)  is $.015 (12690+46.95)/(80000+4695) . For most flights I try to aim to get a least $.02, so this was one of my better redemptions.

I booked this flight 23 days before departure. It was my first time in Japan and seeing the cherry blossoms.

If you are looking into flying to Japan you can expect to pay (+ taxes)  35,000+ miles one way in economy,  60,000+ miles one way in business, 80,000+ miles one way in first class.

What travel hacking mistakes are we missing?

Remember travel hacking is a marathon and not a sprint! It takes time to learn the ins and outs of travel hacking. You can get better with travel hacking over time. There is no rush to learn everything at once!

In travel hacking you take advantage of the current rules in places for airlines, hotels, and credit cards to travel for less, and often times free. A lot of credit cards have sign up bonuses that you can take advantage of if you make the minimum spending requirement in a set period of time.

Travel hacking can be as bougie or budget as you like! I actually do both! There are days when I fly Spirit and days when I fly business and first class. No redemption is ever too small because the goal is to save on travel and to not pay full price.

Did you know that your credit cards come with a lot of perks besides the sign up bonuses?

Sign up bonuses are great because you can use the credit card points as a form of currency to pay for your flight or hotel, but this is just one piece of travel hacking.

You can use the credit card points to pay for travel, and also use the credit card on an everyday basis to earn more points and offset expenses. Learn about different perks on credit cards (some are monthly vs one time) and how these benefits can easily offset the credit card's annual fee and make the credit card an easy money maker.

Most credit cards (both annual fee and no annual fee) come with perks on top of sign up bonuses.

And you might not be taking advantage of them, which might be costing you money.

Learn how to leverage and take advantage of the credit card to get as much value as possible.

Travel Hack That You Need to Know #5  Book travel during off-peak seasons or mid-week to save money on flights, hotels, and activities.

Depending on your destination, there might be an off peak and peak season. Off peak season, such as hurricane season, may be cheaper because it is “hurricane season” and your vacation might end up having or not having a hurricane. However, prices do tend to be cheaper during hurricane season.

Would you risk travel during hurricane season to save money or credit card points? Or would you travel and pay more during peak season and not risk your trip being ruined with the weather? Let me know in the comments.

I’m planning to make this a video series for travel hacks that you need to know, but if you do not want to wait for the videos feel free to go to my link in bio and get the 30 travel hacks in advance!

#Lowdown on what it’s like flying ⬇️ Frontier Airlines. And if do or do not recommend it.

Fun fact I fly business, first, get upgrades (I have American Airlines and Alaska status), I have Southwest Companion Pass and I fly #budgetairlines ! There are different #travelhacking strategies for #creditcard points, #pointsandmiles and cash flights and knowing how to book and optimize your flight is key!

I flew #FrontierAirlines because I had a voucher and the flight was only $258 (not including bags) meanwhile AA was $650! When researching AA flights I noticed there were no 787 airplanes (i.e lie flat seats) to PR. There were also no nonstop flights from the LA area to San Juan, Puerto Rico.

Given the prices and no lie flat seats  I decided to go with Frontier Airlines. I added bags for $356 total to fly #Frontier Airlines.

I checked into my flights last minute on Frontier Airlines because in the past when I checked in right before the deadline, I always got a better seat! Much to my surprise, I was able to get 1E in the front for one of my segments!

Overall, I do recommend Frontier Airlines if you  are open minded being “budget.” There are no WiFi on Frontier airplanes and for one of my segments I was charged $99 because my backpack did not fit in the bin. This brought my total to $456 for flying Frontier Airlines.

For Frontier, you cannot squeeze your bag to fit into the bin, and there has to be some space in the bin. If there is no space in the bin and you squeeze your bag then you will be charged the $99 fee (if the gate agent checks).

My flight on Frontier was also delayed to weather (and so were other airlines) and we also had to stop in Denver  to get more fuel, since the airline staff said we needed more fuel with the weather and backup fuel in case. 

Frontier charges for a paper ticket (free if you check in on the app), seat assignment, carry on, and checked luggage so keep this in mind.

As long as you follow the rules on Frontier and know what you are getting yourself into then you will be fine!

If you are looking for a flight that has WiFi, lie flat seats, and kiosks then Frontier is not for you.

Who else refuses to pay for seat assignment fees on flights? I was able to save $82 and not pay the seat selection fee and still get a window seat! Here’s ⬇️ how you can too.

Whenever I fly #budgetairlines or #basiceconomy I wait until the last minute to check in. This varies from airline to airline for the deadline (so research beforehand), and I checked in 1 hour before for my #FrontierAirlines flight.

Please make sure you setup an alarm to not miss the deadline to check in otherwise you might be denied boarding!

A lot of budget airlines (i.e Spirit and #Frontier ) charge  #seatselection fees. For this MCO-SJU flight the window seats ranged from $31-82!

I noticed that the earlier your check in for flights (if you fly basic economy or budget and do not pay for seat selection) the more likelihood you would get a middle seat. Usually the airlines try to get rid of the middle seats first, so I wait until the last minute to check in as an attempt to get one of the premium seats without paying for the #seatassignment fees!

If the airline runs out of the less wanted seats (i.e middle seats) then they are left with window and aisle seats!

I flew Frontier Airlines last week and this worked well where I either got seats in the aisle, window, or front! I even got the first 2 rows in 2 of my flights!

Of course, your results may vary and this may not work and you may risk getting a middle seat! But I rather risk getting a middle seat vs paying for the seat assignment fee!

Please note, I only do this when I fly budget airlines! If I fly AA  or Alaska I choose my seat ASAP for free, since I have status. This is is a different strategy than using #creditcards #pointsandmiles because on most economy flights (not basic economy flights) you can pick your seat for free! If I fly business or first, I choose my window seat ASAP, since it is free!

I will fly budget airlines if the prices are half of AA/Alaska (otherwise I will try to upgrade with status) or if the redemption is not at least $.02 with credit card points. 

I’m all about not paying the seat assignment fees! What about you? 

#duetopersonalreasons #travelhacks #travelhacking #savingmoney #bougieonabudget

Travel Hack That You Need to Know #6 Use travel deal websites to find discounted flights, hotels, and vacation packages. Here’s ⬇️ more details.

There are travel deal websites like TravelZoo.com! There are deals on hotels, flights, vacation packages, cruises and local , and entertainment deals.

I book a lot of my vacations with credit card points and miles, but sometimes I can’t help find a good cash deal!

Some of these deals are a great way to save money! It definitely puts into perspective about not planning a trip on a specific destination, and instead being open minded about a place after you find a deal!

Some deals are with the vendor direct, but some are third party. If this is a third party deal, I would caution that if something goes wrong it can be sticky to deal with the third party vs the vendor (i.e. hotel or airline) direct, so please keep this in mind. For third party bookings with hotels, most of the time you won’t get points from the hotel from their loyalty program either, since the deal is with the third party vs hotel direct.

Have you book a deal that you found with a travel deal website before?

Who else takes red eye flights to maximize time and to save money? I usually can sleep on airplanes easily, so if I see a red eye option I will usually take it!

I factor in costs between paying extra for a hotel room for the night and also spending time flying vs having fun in my destination.

In the past, hotels have even let me check in early at 8am without paying extra! Of course your results may vary, but some hotels (especially the bigger hotel chains) will let you check in early without issues if they have a room available. You can always leave your bags at the front desk or with the bellman and go explore as well.

I have taken red eye flights with flights I booked with #creditcard points to fly first/business and even #budgetairlines like Frontier and Spirit! So yes, sometimes you find me dead asleep on a #787 in a lie flat bed or even on an Airbus A320!

Do you or do you not fly red eye? Let me know in the comments.

You don’t have to wait for years to save for a trip! You can use points from a credit card sign up bonuses to pay for your flight and hotel. Here’s ⬇️ more details.

Depending on the credit card they will give you a time frame from 3 -6 months to make a sign up bonus. You need to spend a certain amount in that time frame to get the sign up bonus. Some sign up bonuses range from 60,000-150,000 points, and most require at least $4,000 in spend. You can use the  credit card points from the sign up bonus to pay for your flight and hotel.

In addition, if you know you can make multiple sign up bonuses (because you have big expenses coming up) you can sign up for multiple credit cards the same day. Thus, you can use one credit card sign up bonus to pay for your flight and the other one to pay for your hotel!

Please note, I only recommend doing this if you are financially responsible. Please plan ahead to make sure you actually have expenses that you need to make.  Please do not buy things and overspend just to make a credit card sign up bonus. You can easily put yourself in debt this way!

In the past, I have teamed up with friends to pay for rent and their expenses to meet sign up bonus spending requirements, and they just Venmoed me back! So, ask around if your family and friends can help out!

Comment “masterlist” to get a list of top credit cards to consider right now.

If you struggle sleeping on airplanes, consider booking this hotel! Here’s ⬇️ how you can book this hotel instead of paying over $12,000.

This hotel is in the sky! Its actually the airplane! And the flight attendant tucked me into sleep! It’s a therapy dupe of sleeping in the sky instead of paying for a hotel. Here’s how ⬇️ I booked the flight with points instead of paying retail.

I booked a first class flight on #JapanAirlines from Tokyo to Los Angeles. This flight was a red eye. I used 80,000 American Airlines miles and paid $46.95 taxes. Retail price for this flight was $12,690. Flight was in the first class JAL Suite on a Boeing777-300ER (773)

Cost per mile for this flight was $.16 ($12,690/80,000) which is a very good redemption without taxes. Cost per mile with taxes at $.01 (if I cashed out at $.01 but I don’t recommend) is $.015 ($12,690+$46.95)/(80,000+4,695) . For most flights I try to aim to get a least $.02, so this was one of my better redemptions.

I booked this flight 23 days before departure. It was my first time in Japan and seeing the cherry blossoms.

If you are looking into flying to Japan you can expect to pay (+ taxes) 35,000+ miles one way in economy, 60,000+ miles one way in business, 80,000+ miles one way in first class.

Most international business and first class flights have lie flat seats! If you aren’t sure just google the airplane beforehand and check the seat map! You can use Expert Flyer, SeatGuru, and aeroLOPA for seat maps on flights.

FYI I also do red eye flights in basic economy, economy, business, and first class! I rather maximize time in my destination and save money on the hotel.

Please do not ❌ use your credit card points for statement credit for your travel budget. If you want to maximize your points look into these transfer bonuses to save 20%-30% for the same flight!

Some banks (like Amex) points are as low as 😢 .6 per point to cover card charges. So yes, not even 1 cent, and very poor value!

Save 🔖 this post for 20%-30% transfer bonus deadlines.

If you cannot find award space for your trip your best way to use #creditcardpoints (if you do not want to pay cash) is to use the blue bank Reserve.

Not every airline has award space availability, so the room of thumb usually is to check as soon as the airline releases space (google the airline for this) or waiting last minute to see if the airline releases space.

If you just want to settle and book the flight instead of constantly searching for award space on different airlines look into Blue Bank Reserve. This is good for cheap cash bookings because other portals like Amex and Capital One points are only worth 1x vs blue bank reserve they are worth 1.5x in the portal. Feel free to comment #masterlist go to my link in bio if you are interested in any #creditcard s.

Transfer Bonus example
Transfer Ratio: 1,000 =1,300

Blue Bank Deadline: Mon, 7/31/23
Air Canada Aeroplan 20%

Citi Deadline, Fri, 6/30/23
Qatar Airways Privilege Club 30%
Avianca LifeMiles 25%

Once your points leave the bank they will be with the transfer partners and cannot go back. For example, if you transfer Citi points to Qatar the points will be stuck with Qatar and cannot go back to Citi.

Friendly reminder that you can link your British Airways Avios Account To Your Qatar Airways Avios Account, and transfer Avios between the two.

BA (use for #AmericanAirlines ) are good for short haul flights because it starts at 7,500 points + taxes for a redemption. So, with the 30% transfer bonus you need to transfer 6,000 points (since it becomes 7,800 points) instead of 8,000 points (you transfer points in 1,000 increments) to book your fight. So, yes 2,000 points in savings!

If you have an early 6:21am flight save ($200+/10,000+ points) by doing this. Stay at an airport hotel instead of a hotel in the city. Here’s ⬇️ how.

If you have an early morning or late night flight stay near the airport! A lot of airport hotels have free shuttles to pick you up. Airport hotels tend to be cheaper than hotels in the city.

In a recent trip to Washington DC, I stayed at Park Hyatt (20,000 points per night or $339+ per night) and Grand Hyatt (15,000 points per night or $348+ per night).I actually positioned myself and flew into Baltimore instead of DC since airplane tickets were cheaper and the Hyatt Place Baltimore/Bwi Airport was only (5,000 points per night or $119+ per night).

By staying at the Hyatt Place I easily saved $200+ or 10,000+ points per night if you compare that against the Park Hyatt/Grand Hyatt which were 2x-3x the price!

The Hyatt Place also had a free shuttle to the Baltimore Airport and BWI Airport train station, so it was very easy to get to Washington DC Union Station by train. Depending on what time you leave, you can expect train tickets to be $5-19 to take the train one way and about 47 minutes.

I did this for my flight that landed at 8:32pm in Baltimore and my flight that left at 6:21am from Baltimore.

Airport hotels are great for saving money for early morning/late night flights and can be helpful if you can’t do a redeye, but prefer a super early flight at 6am instead.

Do you also save your money/points by staying near the airport when you have an early or late flight? Let me know in the comments!

There are credit cards that 💳 have built in travel protections if you are stranded somewhere! Some credit cards have trip delay insurance, which is helpful right now if you are delayed due to weather, and stuck somewhere for 12+ hours and/or if you stay overnight. Here’s ⬇️ details.

Comment “tripdelay” or DM me for a sample list of #creditcards that have trip delay insurance.These annual #creditcard fees range from $95-$695. The sign up bonuses also range from 30,000-150,000 points. The only card that is no annual fee with trip delay insurance is Marriott Bonvoy Bold.

Marriott Bonvoy Bold
Blue Bank Preferred
World of Hyatt
United Explorer
Marriott Bonvoy Boundless
Marriott Bonvoy Brilliant
Hilton Honors Aspire
Capital One Venture X
Blue Bank Reserve
Delta SkyMiles Reserve
US Bank Altitude Reserve
United Club Infinite
#AmericanExpressPlatinum

Depending on the credit card, trip delay protection will kick in if a common carrier (bus, cruise trip, airplane, and train) delays you by more than 6 hours -12 hours or if you have to stay overnight. The trip has to be for a city away from your residence and less than 365 days in length. Trip delay insurance will help cover expenses while you wait. Expenses include food, transportation, overnight accommodation, toiletries, and medication.

Please note, trip delay insurance will not work if you oversleep or get stuck in traffic.

Please read the fine print for details for your credit card coverage. Coverage is usually up to $500 per covered trip and up to two claims per 12-month period per card. Coverage can only extend to the people traveling with you like your spouse, and dependent children up to age 19 or 26 if full time student.

Please note, coverage is only provided on round-trip travel purchased entirely with that eligible card (paying taxes and fees on award tickets should count) for Amex vs blue bank you can book one way. Trip delay coverage from your credit card will kick in after you use up your frequent flyer/third party insurance. To file a claim call your credit card.

I even took a red eye flight to go to the Maldives! We checked in at 9:30am and we did not pay extra to check in early!

We coordinated with the hotel for our seaplane and to get an ETA. We stayed at Le Méridien. So yes, you can even stay at a fancy 5 star hotel and still get an early check in! Just email the hotel to see if they have any availability to do so. 

I have done a lot of red eye flights and have yet to have a hotel reject for me checking in too early! The only instance I had was in Chicago where I had to wait for an hour or so in, since housekeeping was cleaning the room. It wasn’t a big deal, since I was using WiFi on my laptop in the lobby while they were cleaning!

Retail price for our #overwatervilla for 5 nights was $3,135.76, but instead we paid 170,000 Marriott points! This was booked before the devaluation. Since we stayed for 5 nights, the cost per point would be $.018! When you book 5 nights with points, the 5th night is free! You can also send another Marriott user up to 100,000 points per year. 

#travelhacks #redeye

Explore the hotel and go to the pool if your hotel’s room is not available yet! This is great if you get to the hotel before the 4pm check in time and if your room is not ready yet. 

Who else usually gets to their destination super early?  I usually try to take red eye or early morning flights to max out my time at the destination.

Most of the hotels I have been to do not have an issue with me checking in early (sometimes at 9:30am), and do not charge me extra! However, if the room is not available yet, sometimes I use the WiFi in the hotel lobby (until the room is ready) or explore the hotel!

Most hotels I have been to do not have an issue with me exploring the hotels’ facilities (beforehand), such as the pool as long as I have a reservation. If you aren’t sure you can always call the hotel beforehand to see if early check in is available for your hotel stay or ask if you can use the hotel’s facilities until your room is ready.

This is at Alila Ventana Big Sur and you can transfer your blue bank points to Hyatt to book this hotel! We stayed at Alila Ventana Big Sur and it would have been $4,715.73 per night for our suite! However, it was free with points because we did it the #bougieonabudget way. Food was included for the hotel stay and alcohol is extra.Standard rooms to book are 40,000 points per night, peak at 45,000 points per night, and off peak are 35,000 points per night.

Who else does not want pay extra for baggage fees for their flight? Sometimes I fly personal item only to avoid extra fees? Here’s how you can save $30+ on #baggage fees if you do this instead of paying for a checked bag or carry on.

One of my favorite #travelhacks is that I have a clothing subscription sent to my hotel, so I do not have to pay for a carry on or checked bag when I’m traveling. Just call the hotel beforehand, so they know to expect a package.

Sometimes I do this when I fly #SpiritAirlines or #basiceconomy on United when I do not want to pay $30+ for a carry on or checked bag. That’s easily $60 roundtrip in savings.

I tested out a few clothing subscriptions, such as Haverdash ($59/month), Rent the Runway $$69-$149/month), and FashionPass ($89-$149/month).

You can see how if you get a clothing subscription like Haverdash it already offset the #carryon fees, since the clothing subscription is $59 but a roundtrip carry on fees can be $60 ($30 each way). In addition, you can get wear different clothes for your trip from Haverdash vs buying new clothes.

My personal favorite is FashionPass, since I’m Los Angeles based and so is the company. I like their styles the most and if you order by 12pm the day prior it will come the next day. For example, if you order by Monday 11am then your delivery will come by Tuesday if you are Los Angeles based.

You can use “ANGEL1D” to get $40 Off on FashionPass.

I think a #clothingsubscription is especially helpful if you are going to multiple events or weddings, since you can wear different dresses for each event instead of paying $100+ for different outfits.

You also do not have to wash any of the clothes and can just mail the clothes back (they give you a pre-paid envelope to drop off at USPS, UPS, or FedEx).

If you liked tips like these on saving on clothes you will like the most recent @bougieinabackpack episode “Episode 05: Hot Girl Hacks: Frugal Fashion Savings and Stacks.” We covered clothing subscription and a few other clothing hacks!

Have you tried a clothing subscription? Let me know in the comments.

I didn’t have a lot of money growing up, so I learned how to use the systems in place to save money and travel for less. Here’s ⬇️ how you can too. 

Comment “blueprint” to grab a free travel hacking blueprint to learn how to get started with travel hacking. The blueprint goes over what is travel hacking, different bank rules, transfer partners, and airline alliances. You can also find this in the link in my bio.

Depending on the airline you can book flights for $5.60+ taxes and with points. This flight is on American Airlines from LAX - MIA and I was upgraded to first  on this flight, since I had status! On this flight I enjoyed eating salmon and a mimosa!

Fun fact I did not have a lot of money growing up and was even a first generation college student! I also had free lunch growing up in school. In order to survive, I learned how to use the tools that were available and use them to save money. I applied to a bunch of scholarships and grants in undergrad and got free housing, free tuition, and $7,000 in spending money to study abroad in Rome. Nowadays, I travel hack mostly with points, miles, stacks, and leveraging programs to travel for less.

Please note, I do not recommend anyone to get into travel hacking if you have debt or cannot pay all your bills in full. Otherwise this hobby will put you into debt.

Got lucky with the early hotel check in at 8am and enjoyed free breakfast! I took a red eye and luckily the hotel had a room available for check in. On top of that, some hotels have free breakfast until 9am-10am.

So yes, I enjoyed my free early hotel check in and free breakfast. Not all hotels have free breakfast, but for the hotels that do have free breakfast included like Hyatt Place they actually throw out the food! So, if you get there before they stop serving food around 9-10am then you can grab a bite. Please always ask politely first, but the hotel staff never had issues with me eating the free breakfast, since they said they throw it out.

If the hotel does not have any rooms available for early hotel check in you can always leave your bags with the hotel’s front desk or bellman and then go explore your destination or hotel! Some hotels will let you enjoy the amenities in the meantime, such as pool, lobby with WiFi, and gym. Of course, your results may vary, and I am just sharing my experience.

I think Hyatt Place is a great budget friendly for hotels, since they have breakfast included. This is especially helpful if you are traveling with a lot of family and friends to save money on food. Depending on where you go, I have been to a Hyatt Place that is Category 1 near the airport in Baltimore and Chicago. I have also been to a a Category 4 Hyatt Place in NYC in Long Island City in Queens (1 train stop from Manhattan).

You can transfer your blue bank credit card points to Hyatt. Category 1 ranges from 3,500-6,500 points per night, and Category 4 ranges from 12,000-18,000 points per night. The Hyatt personal credit card even gives you a free 1 night Category 1-4 hotel certificate to use each year.

Travel Hack That You Need to Know #8 Use travel, hotel, and airline credit cards to pay for travel expenses like flights, hotels, and rental cars to earn even more points or miles. Better yet, stack and get a free hotel night certificate (on a no annual fee credit card!

Please note, this Hilton Sign Up Offer is ending next week on 7/19/23! The good news is that you can take advantage of a no annual fee option, as well.

Comment “Hiltoncard” if you want a referral link for Hilton credit cards.

There are currently there 3 Hilton cards that have at least a 70,000-150,000 points & free night certificate offer if you spend $1,000-$4,000 in 3 months.

Hilton Honors - no annual fee
Hilton Surpass - $95 annual fee
Hilton Honors Business - $95 annual fee

You can stack and get different Hilton credit cards. Amex has the 1 in 5 days rule for 1 Amex credit card every 5 days, and 2 in 90 days rule, where 2 Amex credit cards every 90 days.

Given that the deadline is not until 7/19/23 you have time if you want to apply for more than 1 Amex credit card to take advantage of the Hilton Honors Free Night Reward for a free hotel stay. This is perfect if you want to get a quick weekend getaway, since you can easily stack these 2 credit cards to use for 2 free nights! There is no cap to use the free night certificate as long as you find availability! So use this free night certificate at expensive properties like Maldives!

These credit cards are great if you can do at least 1 credit card and wait for 6 days to see if you are eligible, so apply to 1 Amex card by 7/13/23 and then wait for at least 6 days and apply for the second Amex card by 7/19/23 if you want wiggle room and do not want to risk applying too close to the date.

Please apply to credit cards if you are financially responsible and know that you can make the sign up bonus! Otherwise they can potentially put you in debt!

I have no shame in being bougie in a backpack and going to the American Express Centurion Lounge with a Spirit ticket and then getting a free hotel room (and a free upgraded suite!) at Hyatt. Here’s ⬇️ how you can too.

Since I have an #AmericanExpressPlatinum card if I have an airplane ticket within 3 hours before departure I can enter the American Express Centurion Lounge. So yes, my Spirit ticket qualifies as an airplane ticket that I can use to enter the airport lounge, since I have an American Express Platinum card. I also make $792 off my Amex Plat card based on the offers and credits on the card, so the credit card is an easy money maker for me.

I would rather much save money and fly Spirit multiples times vs have enough money to buy only 1 airplane ticket on Delta, American Airlines, or United. A lot of times Spirit is half the cost of these, so you can technically travel more and squeeze in 2 trips vs 1 trip. I usually save my #pointsandmiles for international flights, since I usually get better redemptions.

Flying budget airlines lets you save money and do more things.

So, yes meanwhile people are waiting at the airport gate paying more for their flight to fly Delta, United, or AA I am chilling in the American Express Centurion Lounge and flying Spirit. I will then happily enjoy my free upgraded hotel room in Hyatt! I have Hyatt Globalist, so this allows me to get a free upgrades to suites if they are available. You can transfer blue bank points to Hyatt to book hotel rooms.

Fun fact I actually did a status match from Hyatt Globalist to get Spirit Gold status! This status match was a few months ago, and is no longer active.

Would you rather travel more with budget airlines and go to an airport lounge or pay more and travel less on Delta, AA, and United and not have access to an airport lounge? Let me know in the ⬇️ comments.

Reminder for all my travel hackers that if you want to  save more money, from your credit card perks  then you got to make things easier for yourselves by being organized! Here’s ⬇️ how.

For my monthly credit card perks, I try to do all my pickups in one day.  BevMo (for monthly $10 GoPuff credits on Blue Bank), Office Depot (if I want any gift cards at 5x with my Blue Bank Ink cash card), and Sprouts (Instacart credit on my Blue Bank reserve card) are all in the same plaza. Since they are in the same plaza that means I can easily knock out multiple credit card perks and benefits!

Instead of forgetting to use each benefit,  I make a date on my calendar for either one or two days out of the month to use my credit card perks. These perks are like coupons because they are statement credits. If  I don’t use these monthly credits then I lose them! They do not roll over! 

So yes, create the time and make a simple calendar recurring invite to yourself to use your credit card benefits and perks!

Please note, for blue bank sometimes it takes a few days to process the statement credits, so try to not push it and make buffer time.

1)For my monthly $10 GoPuff credits on Blue Bank I do multiple transactions to pickup at BevMo 

2) For Office Depot I will make a stop if I want to get 5x on gift cards with my Blue Bank Ink Cash cards

3) For Sprouts I can use my monthly $15  Instacart credit on my Blue Bank Reserve card for store pickup at Sprouts for groceries

For both GoPuff and Instacart you can easily stack with a shopping portal like AA or Rakuten to earn miles or cash back.

Do not make things harder for yourselves! Make a date on your calendar to remind yourself to do all your credit card perks in a day or 2! Hopefully you can find places that are close by to each other as well, such as the same plaza!

Fun fact travel hacking with credit cards is similar to couponing! You have a lot of benefits and perks on the credit cards, and you save money by using them!

It can be similar to extreme couponing where you layer on a coupon on top of another coupon to save more money.

For example, a lot of my purchases I sometimes get for free, since I layer on and stack different things like a shopping portal, credit card offer, promo code, and a third party app.

For flights and hotels it is similar where you use credit card points and get the hotel or flight for a discounted price instead of paying the retail price value. Depending on the credit card transfer partner, they might have an award chart which can be cheaper than paying the cash price of the hotel room. 

Sometimes there are also special deals like a transfer bonus that you can use to save even more money on your flight or hotel. With a transfer bonus because of the special promotion you need less points to transfer out, since there is a special deal going on with the transfer partner.

Please do not go out of your way to use a credit card benefit or perk if it costs you money! The whole purpose is to save money, and to not put yourself into debt if it costs you money and also if you do not pay your bills in full and on time.

Do you see how travel hacking and stacking are similar to couponing? Let me know your thoughts in the comments.

Southwest Companion Pass allows you to bring a friend for free with you on a flight. As long as you have a paid ticket or ticket booked with SW points, you can bring your friend unlimited times to travel with you! You just need to pay the taxes! Here’s how ⬇️ you can get Southwest Companion Pass.

Last minute flights can be very expensive! On Southwest I was able to add @amanda.exploring as a Companion the week before and saved $600+ on her flight! Paying $5.60+ each way ($11.20 roundtrip) is a lot better than paying $600+! 

Comment “SW2for1” to learn more about Southwest Credit cards.

Current Offer
Get SW Companion Pass with the Southwest Rapid Rewards Premier Business Credit Card (apply by 9/4/23), but the spending requirement is high at $15,000. You can earn 60,000 points after you spend $3,000 on purchases in the first three months from your account opening. Plus, you’ll earn an additional 60,000 points after you spend $15,000 on purchases in first 9 months from account opening.

If you can get all of that $15,000 in spending done before the end of the year, you’ll have 120,000 points from the bonus plus at least 15,000 points from the spending. You can then enjoy the Companion Pass for the rest of the year and all of 2024.

Better Offer
Wait until November/December to see if you can make the sign up bonuses/spending requirements  from 1 personal SW card and one 1 SW biz card (ranges from $1,000-$5,000 per card). You need 135,000 points to earn SW Companion Pass, which you can also get from referrals and shopping portals. Finish all the spending requirements after January 2, 2024 and you will have SW Companion Pass for all 2024 and 2025.

BTW SW doesn’t have sheet masks, I got those from Amazon so Amanda and I could have hydrated skin and not dry skin during our flight! Don’t forget to wear sunscreen on your flight because of the UV rays.

Booking a flight with airline miles is pretty much like a refundable ticket! You can get the miles and taxes refunded. Here’s ⬇️ why this is better than paying cash for airline tickets and how I did this with Southwest Airlines.

Using miles is a lot better than paying cash for a flight because unless you paid for the flight as a refundable ticket, it is hard to get the cash back. You might be issued a store credit for the airline or not even a refund (and you just lost the money you paid for the airline ticket).

@amanda.exploring and I recently went on a trip to Denver and we were not sure what time we wanted to leave on Sunday. So, I ended up booking 2 flights with one earlier in the day and one later in the night with SW points. We ended up staying longer in Denver, so I ended up cancelling the earlier flight an hour before it left! I instantly got my Southwest points back in my account, and the taxes refunded to my credit card. Amanda is my Companion on Southwest Companion Pass, so her flight was free and I got the taxes refunded for her flight right away too.

Depending on the airline program, miles may or may not expire and you can have flexibility with booking flights. You can easily cancel a flight and get a refund for both the taxes paid and the miles go straight back to your account. Of course this varies from airline program to program (some aren’t free to cancel), so make sure you check beforehand.

So, if you are not sure about a trip and you already have airline miles in the program you can book the flight with miles. Once you decide if you want to go for sure or not you can either take the flight or get a refund for the miles and taxes. This is also helpful for last minute changes.

Do you also like this flexibility with airline miles and have you done this before? Let me know in the comments.

You can still fly domestic and go to the airport lounge at the international terminal. You just need to tell airport security you are going to the lounge and to show them your airplane ticket within 3 hours or departure. Also Amex Plat recently went through some changes, but for me I’m still keeping the card, since its a $792 money maker. Here’s ⬇️ more details.

Changes includes:

1) $195 per authorized user instead of $175 for 3 authorized users

2) On AmexPlat if you added someone as Amex Gold (no annual fee) this will now be the Companion Platinum card

3) Audible will be replaced by Wall Street Journal starting 10/2/23 for the monthly $20 entertainment credit

4) Sign up bonus is now $8,000 in 6 months to get the 80K sign up bonus

5) Mixed reports if you still can get a welcome bonus on the co-branded cards like Morgan Stanley and Schwab

I’m personally not bothered by the recent changes, since if anything I have a better chance of going into the #airportlounge . I haven’t had any long wait times at LAX, but I have waited a while to enter #centurionlounge at Miami, Dallas, and Houston, and I was not happy about that as a customer that pays the full annual fee price of $695. I do think that people who pay the full price should have priority over people who are just authorized users to enter, since they are paying more.

The biggest change I’m more concerned about is that if you can/cannot get another co-branded Amex Plat card. This does effect my 5/24 status, so if its not true then great, and if is it true that you can’t get one then I wished a got a Schwab and Morgan Stanley card ages ago!

Here’s the Amex Plat credits ⬇️ I actually use $ $1,487 credits

$189 CLEAR
$200 Uber credit

$200 Hotel credit
$200 airline incidental credit
$150 Corporate Advantage Program credit
20,000 points + $150 retention
$98 Walmart+
-$695 Annual Fee
$792 Money Maker

See how that equals to $1,487 in credits for a $695 card? This card can be a $792 money maker.

The banks are not teaching you how to get at least 2 trips instead of 1 trip. But we are ⬇️ and you can join us.  If you are using your credit card points as statement credit to pay for travel then you are easily overpaying on travel.

Comment “teachme” to learn how you can get more value for your points. I usually try to get at least 2 cents per points whenever I’m using points to pay for flights and hotels. My highest redemptions have been 19 cents per point with taxes for flights and 10 cents per point for hotels. 

Instead of going on 1 trip where I would have had a fixed rate of 1 cent per point as statement credit, I  use transfer partners strategically and transfer out my  points to get a better redemption. So yes, if I used my credit card points as statement credit then I would have went only on 1 trip vs for the same flight I could have went 19 times.

Not all transfer partners are based on a fixed rate of 1 cent per point. Depending on how far you are going and the transfer partner you can actually maximize and use their award chart (if they have one) strategically to get to your destination.

If you wan to learn more about these strategies, comment “teach me” and I can send you more details on travel hacking strategies and how to not pay full price to travel. And how you can easily get at least 2 cents per point for you trip.

The #1 thing that people tell me that is they do not want to do is to manage a lot of credit cards. However, managing a lot of credit cards is much easier than you think with autopay, and you can travel a lot faster and save more money that way! Here’s ⬇️ how.

A big chunk of my “free travel” is from the points from credit card sign up bonuses, and the math doesn’t make sense if you just use one credit card on all your purchases. For example, if you spend $1,500 a month and use a credit card that earns only 2x on purchases that will leave you with 3,000 points for one month. In 3 months at 2x you would have spent $4,500 in 3 months, and got 9,000 points total. Meanwhile, if you worked on a sign up bonus that required spending $4,000 in 3 months you would have gotten a credit card sign up bonus that was worth at least 60,000 in points. I can go on way more trips with 60,000 points that I got in 3 months from a credit card sign up bonus vs 9,000 points from using 1 credit card.

Set up autopay as soon as you get your credit card! I’m not saying to ignore your credit card by getting autopay, but it is a safety check in place to make sure  it  gets paid on time. I still think it is good to look at your credit card to see expenses and to manage your budget.

In addition, a lot of credit cards have “credit card offers” on the cards, which are essentially coupons. So, if you only have a few credit cards then you are limited to the amount of savings you can get  vs if you have more credit cards that have different coupons on their card.

I usually open at least one credit card every few months and a lot of credit cards require at least $4,000 in spending in 3 months (some are higher and lower). So, if your monthly budget on expenses is $1,500 anyway then travel hacking can easily work for you. You just need to manage it by staying within your budget, having systems in place like autopay, and by being responsible by not buying things you would normally not buy.

For example, 100,000 Hilton points is very different than having 80,000 American Express points. 80K Amex points is actually more valuable since you can transfer to airline and hotel programs vs being stuck with Hilton.

That $95 credit card is at least $750 in value and you have travel protections! Instead of using your debit card to pay for travel, consider getting a travel credit card with a sign up bonus that gets you even more value, so you can save more money. Here’s ⬇️ how I got more than $11,000 in value.

Comment “teachme” to learn how you can get more value for your points and some of my travel hacking strategies.

Here’s how ⬇️ to turn that $95 credit card into  more than $11K in value.

The blue bank preferred card has a sign up bonus for 60,000 points if you spend $4,000 in 3 months. 60,000 points is worth at least $750 in the bank portal. However, the points are worth even more if you transfer them out.

For example, for my flight from SEA- HND the retail price was $11,493. However, instead of paying cash or using the bank portal, I transferred out my points to Air Canada to fly ANA #businessclass . I paid 55,000 miles + $76 CAD dollars ($56.25 USD) instead.

So yes, you can see how that $95 credit card saved me over $11,000 since I was able to use a transfer partner instead of paying $11,493 retail. That $95 credit card also has travel protections baked in like trip cancellation, trip interruption, trip delay, baggage delay, lost luggage, auto rental collision damage waiver, and travel accident coverage (more details on the blue bank website).

I usually try to get at least 2 cents per points whenever I’m using points to pay for flights and hotels. My highest redemptions have been 19 cents per point with taxes for flights and 10 cents per point for hotels.

There is nothing wrong with doing any side hustle like driving for Uber, selling on Ebay, or delivering food on Grubhub. However, if you are saving for a big goal like a trip and want to get extra money to get there quicker, definitely consider doing this ⬇️ to get at least $1,250 for your travel budget in 3 months.

Instead of only working hard on your #sidehustle , also take advantage of the fact that you now qualify for business credit cards with your side hustle! You can use the credit card sign up bonuses and points to pay for a trip. You do not need a fancy LLC and you can sign up for a business card as a #soleproprietor with your name being the business name!

Comment “100K” to learn more about the Blue Bank Ink Preferred card. There is a 100,000 sign up bonus if you spend $8,000 in your first 3 months. This credit card also has a $95 annual fee, and the 100K sign up bonus is worth at least $1,250.

A #soleproprietorship is when you own an incorporated business by yourself. Business income does not include investments, Only money earned by doing something.

Save 🔖 this post for steps on how to sign up for a business card as a #soleproprietor with your side hustle! Here ⬇️ are steps.

1) Your business name is your own name. For example, if your name is David John Smith on your personal #creditcards then you can put David John Smith as your name and put David John Smith as your Business name. If you do not have a middle name, and you name is David Smith, then it would be David Smith as your name and David Smith as your Business Name.

2)Your Tax ID Number is your Social Security Number

3) Your business income is the amount you will be earning/estimating from your side income

Do not make up a business name. If you do it can void your application.

Please note, I am not your financial advisor, and this content is for informational purposes only. Thanks!

Do you also take red eye flights to maximize time and to save money? I usually can sleep on airplanes easily, so if I see a red eye option I will usually take it to avoid paying for a hotel room!

I factor in costs between paying extra for a hotel room for the night and also spending time flying vs having fun in my destination.

In the past, hotels have even let me check in early at 8am without paying extra! Of course your results may vary, but some hotels (especially the bigger hotel chains) will let you check in early without issues if they have a room available. I’m 🚫not addicted to credit cards. I’m addicted to the bougie ✈️ travel lifestyle, I wouldn't have it it wasn't for them! The main reason why I eat at airport lounges, stay at nice hotels, and fly biz/first is because of the credit card benefits and the ability to use points. Here's ⬇️ how you can too.

If you have big expenses or spend at least $1,334 in expenses each month then you can be a good candidate for travel hacking.  Most credit card sign up bonuses require at least $4,000 in spending in 3 months (hence spending at least $1,334 each month).

Credit card sign up bonuses can help you get to your trip faster! And you can get your travel fund budget within 3 months.

For example, the blue bank ink preferred card has a 100K sign up bonus that’s worth at least $1,250 in travel money ($8K spending requirement in 3 months, $95 annual fee). The blue bank preferred card has a 60K sign up bonus that’s worth at least $750 in travel money ($4K spending requirement in 3 months, $95 annual fee).

Depending on the credit card, some sign up bonuses require spending  between $1-$15,000 to get the sign up bonus, so you need to be strategic on what credit card to get.  Annual fees range from $0-695.

Once you meet the sign up bonus spending requirement you will usually get the points/miles  within 1 - 2 statement cycles.

Please note, I do not recommend travel hacking to anyone that does not pay their bills on time or is not responsible with money! Otherwise this hobby can put you into debt.

Make the spending requirement (responsibly), pay your annual fees and bills on time, and use the points to book hotels and flights. It is as simple as that!
