You do not need a traditional small business or LLC to get a biz credit card! Here’s ⬇️ how to apply & qualify for the 90,000 credit card sign up offers.

Comment “bizcard” to get a link for these credit cards. Get 90,000 points on each of the cards if you spend $6,000 in your first 3 months of account opening.

Please note, you must be 5/24 at the time of application, which means you opened 4 credit cards max in the past 24 months. Capital One, TD, and Discover #businesscreditcards count towards 5/24.

Keep in mind, blue bank also has the 30 day business rule. You cannot open 2 personal cards or 1 personal and 1 business card every 30 days.

#Sidehustle is considered a #soleproprietorship , which makes you eligible for business credit cards. #Sidehustles examples include consulting, driving for Uber, delivering food on Doordash, and selling things on eBay or Craigslist.

Here ⬇️ are steps on how to apply as a #soleproprietor.

1) Your business name is your own name. For example, if your name is David John Smith on your personal #creditcards then put David John Smith as your name & put David John Smith as your Business name. If you do not have a middle name & your name is David Smith, then it would be David Smith as your name & David Smith as your Business Name.

2)Your Tax ID Number is your Social Security Number

3) Your business income is the amount you will be earning/estimating from your side income

Do not make up a business name. If can void your application.

Please note, I am also not your financial advisor & this content is for informational purposes only. Thanks!

Who else 😂 has barely made the 50 lbs weight limit for checked luggage  when flying? Here ⬇️ are some ways to save on checked bag fees.

Depending on the airline it can be free or $30-35 for checked bags. Sometimes after the 2nd bag it’s even higher at $150 for the third checked bag! Most airlines have a 50 lb limit and if you go over you can either pay a fee or wear a bunch of clothes to make the 50 lb limit.

Fun fact I rarely check bags unless they are free or I have a really long trip where I need extra clothes and I don’t want to do laundry.

Saved on checked bag fees ⬇️

1) Luckily Southwest Airlines has 2 free checked bags, no change fees, and you can cancel your flight 10 minutes before departure! This is one of my favorite airlines to fly for this reason and  I have Companion Pass, so I can take a friend to fly for free! You can change your companion up to 3 times in a calendar year. And yes, they get 2 free checked bags too!

2) If you have status with an airline usually you get at least one free bag.

3) If you fly internationally in business/first you can usually get a free checked bag.

4) Credit cards. Depending on the credit card there are some with free checked bags. Some have a limit of how many you can do each year, and some like Amex Plat have a $200 airline incidental credit that you can use towards checked bags.

Do you usually check in bags or are you carry on only? Let me know in the comments!

Travel hacking is not ⬇️ fake. The key is looking for availability and also making sure your spending habits are aligned so you can get the points to travel.

Do not spend money in the sake of spending money. Only apply for credit cards if you have big or monthly expenses that can meet the sign up bonus for you to get points. If you have friends that can pay you back money for their expenses then that can work too. Also get into this hobby only if you can pay your bills in full otherwise this can put you into potential debt!

A big part of travel hacking is also looking for availability.

If you need specific dates for traveling then you need to either book out super early (like almost a year out or whenever award space is released) or book last minute. There has been times that I have done same day bookings and trips within 2-3 weeks prior just because the award space was released last minute. If you still can’t find the dates you want then you can always book in the portal and pay slightly more than transferring out your points.

This is at the Park Hyatt Paris-Vendome and a room here retails for 45,000 points per night or $2,280 euros ($2,397.14 USD/night), since it is Paris Fashion Week.

Imagine you took advantage of credit card sign up bonuses and used it to pay for this Hyatt hotel instead of $4,794.27 retail for 2 nights.

Currently, the Blue Bank Ink cards have a 90,000 sign up bonus. Comment “bizcard” to get a link for these credit cards. Get 90,000 points on each of the cards if you spend $6,000 in your first 3 months of account opening.

If you have blue bank $95 card or $550 card you can move your points from these #businesscredit cards to that card to transfer to 14 airline and hotel programs.

Credit card sign up bonuses usually show up by the next statement cycle after you meet the spending requirement.

So yes, you can use take advantage of that 90,000 sign up offer to pay for this hotel when it is a peak time to visit Paris, and save $4,794.27.

If I can’t get a seat in first/business class then I will prefer to sit in the back of the airplane next to no one! Yes, it is further away from exiting and is close to restrooms, but I rather sit alone next to someone. I don’t mind having poor woman’s first class with an entire row to myself.

Whenever I fly first/business class I can pick my seat for free and if I fly budget airlines there is usually a fee if you want to pick your seat or board early, and I am not paying for any of these fees!

I would much rather sit further in the back next to nobody than to be in the middle of the airplane sitting next to someone. Yes, sitting in the middle section is closer to the front of the airplane and the exit, but if I sit in the back I have more space and do not not have to sit next to anyone.

On a recent flight on Southwest I got a seat in the last row and also got easy access to snacks, since the Southwest flight attendants were right behind me! I also got free WiFi from my Southwest Performance Business Credit Card. So yes, I was pretty bougie in a backpack with the entire row to myself, snacks, and free WiFi!

Would you rather sit in the middle of the airplane next to someone or have an entire row to yourself in the back of the airplane? Let me know in the comments!

Don’t waste your money 🚫 and stress for these checked bag fees! 

Depending on the airline some charge $25-89 for checked bags! Avoid the fees by being carry on only or even personal item only! 

 Save yourself the money and stress and be carry on only! If you are carry on only your bag will be with you in the overhead bin and within arms distance! 

Unless that checked bag is free then I will not do it! I will squeeze everything I have to be carry on only or even personal item only.

Before checking in a bag consider if you can do laundry at your destination. Is there a place nearby that does drop off for laundry?

Doing drop off laundry in my experience has been cheaper than doing laundry at hotels (which usually charge by the item). Some hostels and airbnbs even have a washer and dryer on site, so that can also save you the time and convenience!

If you can’t be carry on only remember that some credit cards offer free checked bags and airline incidental credits that you can use to offset bag fees. If you are flying first/business or have status then usually (depending on the route) you can get at least one free checked bag as well!

Do you usually check in a bag or are you carry on only? Let me know in the comments!

Using ⬇️ public transit is a lot easier than you think!  I saved $46.66 euros ($49.40 USD) by using public transit instead of Uber to my hotel and airport each way. Save 🔖this for you next trip to Paris!

A Navigo Week Pass is valid from Monday at 00:00 to Sunday 23:59. The deadline to buy a 
Navigo cards for the current week up is Thursday 11:59pm. Next week’s Navigo card is on sale from Friday morning  onwards.

Navigo costs $30 euros ($31.76 USD) for an unlimited week pass! You also have to pay $5 euros ($5.29 USD) for the pass and bring either a passport photo or pay $8 euros ($8.47 USD) from a passport photo machine at the airport. So, your total costs should be $35+  euros ($37.05 USD)  for the pass . I bought mine at the airport.

Navigo does not cover OrlyVal (if you are going to Paris Orly airport), so I used Orlybus, which is covered by Navigo.  OrlyVal costs $9.30 euros and it was only an extra 10-15 minutes for me to take Orlybus.

The weekly pass was well worth it, since I used the metro everywhere even though I was there for only 2 days. You also have to scan your pass before you enter the train station.

I recommend using a credit card that doesn’t charge foreign transaction fees like Capital One (including no annual fee cards).

Comment “noforeignfees” to learn how Capital One does not charge #foreigntransactionfees for any card.

Of course be alert on your surroundings. I put all my bags to the front of me and did not get pickpocketed at all. You can also buy cheap locks from the dollar store.

1 point 🚫does not equal 1 cent! 1 point can even be worth 5 cents if you use your points right. Here’s ⬇️ how.

Comment “bizcard” to get a link for these credit cards. Get 90,000 points on each of the cards if you spend $6,000 in your first 3 months of account opening.

This is at Park Hyatt Paris-Vendome and a room here retails for 45,000 points per night or $2,280 euros ($2,397.14 USD/night), since it is Paris Fashion Week. The cost per point for my stay here was 5 cents! 

Currently, Blue Bank Ink cards have a 90,000 sign up bonus. 

If you have blue bank $95 card or $550 card you can move your points from these #businesscredit cards to that card to transfer to 14 airline and hotel programs.

The key is looking for availability and also making sure your spending habits are aligned so you can get the points to travel.

Do not spend money in the sake of spending money. Only apply for credit cards if you have big or monthly expenses that can meet the sign up bonus for you to get points. If you have friends that can pay you back money for their expenses then that can work too. Also get into this hobby only if you can pay your bills in full otherwise this can put you into potential debt!

A big part of travel hacking is also looking for availability.

If you need specific dates for traveling then you need to either book out super early (like almost a year out or whenever award space is released) or book last minute. There has been times that I have done same day bookings and trips within 2-3 weeks prior just because the award space was released last minute. If you still can’t find the dates you want then you can always book in the bank portal and pay slightly more than transferring out your points.

Credit card sign up bonuses usually show up by the next statement cycle after you meet the spending requirement.

Convinced myself the extra time on the bus in Rome was a city sightseeing tour! Save 🔖this for tips on the Rome metro.

Rome is known for pickpocketing, so please be alert and keep things to the front of you! Bags with zippers and locks are your best friend!

A 24 hour metro pass costs $7 euros which is $7.40 USD!

A 48 hour metro pass costs $12.50 euros which is $13.20 USD!

A 72 hour metro pass costs $18 euros which is $19 USD!

A weekly metro pass costs $24 euros which is $25.30 USD!

Took the bus in Rome to get around town, and saw a lot of landmarks but please factor in extra time since the buses then to run late!

Taking the bus in Rome is based on the honor system, so you technically don’t need to scan your ticket before entering. I would be careful with that since the police can easily go on a bus and check if you have a ticket or not, and give you a fine if you don’t!

You can buy a metro pass at a metro station, tobacco and newspaper shop.

Credit cards were pretty easy here and I did not have to take out Euros!

I actually studied abroad in Rome years ago and forgot how bad the public transit is though! Luckily it is cheap.

This is EXACTLY how...⬇️

I calculated the numbers and so far I saved over $40,000 from travel hacking this year! (and I did not save $40,000 for years to get here in my travel fund either).

And for full transparency most of my travel budget is not from having a devoted savings account either. Instead it is fun from travel hacking!

TRAVEL HACKING. I took advantage of credit card sign up offers and used the points to pay for my trips! And no I did not spend extra money to reach these credit card sign up bonuses.

You do not need to spend extra money to make a credit sign up bonus.

Instead you need to time your sign up bonuses when you have big purchases, so you can take advantage of  the sign up bonuses. This year I was able to make a few sign up bonuses because I had big purchases and I also had friends/family members pay me back after I charged my credit card for their purchases. They just sent me a Venmo or paid me in cash back!

And none of these trips were booked with a bank travel portal either! I used my credit card points to transfer out points to transfer partners to pay for most of my trips. Some were booked directly with the airline and hotel, since I already had points in that program!

Transfer partners are key to travel hacking because you usually get more value. Some of my highest redemptions have been 10 cents per point, meanwhile the bank portal can be at set rate at 1 cent per point, which isn’t usually the best value.

Now how the heck can you learn about transfer partners?

Ps - what I teach in this blueprint is exactly how I travel hack my trips! My Japan trip was worth over $30K alone during Cherry Blossom Season this March!

And don’t forget to grab the one time offer for stacking at checkout! You’ll learn how I do not pay full price for anything and how I stack and layer on discounts instead!

LEARN FROM MY MISTAKES ⤵️

Not all point redemptions are equal!

Using your credit card points in the bank portal isn’t always the best way to use your points.

A lot of  banks have transfer partners, which you can use (if you find availability) to book the exact same flight! Most of the time it is cheaper than using the bank portal.

In this video we saw how the exact same Delta flight was 50,000 points + $5.60 in taxes with Virgin Atlantic (a transfer partner of the bank) vs $3,782 or 252,080 in the bank portal!

It’s never too late…

I didn’t have a lot of money growing up, so I did not travel much. I always thought you had to be a rich person to see the world.

But honestly, it forced me to think outside the box, and to see what resources I could take advantage of to pay for travel, such as scholarships, credit card sign up bonuses, and essentially travel hacking.

And now, it’s been 11 years since I started travel hacking, and my life will never be the same 😭

In the last 11 years I have (thanks to travel hacking):

- been to 40+ countries and all 7 continents
- flown first/biz and budget airlines :P
- stayed in hostels and got free hotel suite upgrades
- not paid full price for anything by stacking
- traveled for pennies on the dollar

So how in the world did I do all that in 11 years?

And how did I save $40,000+ year to date on 2023 travel (not including November and December) trips?

➡️ First, I started actually travel hacking by getting credit card sign up bonuses (instead of just reading about it!)

THEN, I got SUPER serious about transfer partners instead of just using the bank portal.

The bank portal isn’t always the best way to use your points by the way! Sometimes you will end up paying even 200,000 points extra for the same flight!

Here’s the lie…➡️

Travel hacking STILL REQUIRES EFFORT!

If you want to get more points, you have to actually learn how spending categories work and how using different credit cards for different purchases can help you get more points.

If you want to go on more trips, getting more than 1 credit card sign up bonus will help you get there faster than using just 1 credit card to pay for everything.

Don’t let a little bit of work scare you off, because if you focus on the RIGHT KIND of travel hacking concepts, it really is possible to get more points and go on more trips!

ESPECIALLY when you know how travel hacking can essentially make travel free and offset your travel expenses!

It’s a very simple process, to be honest, but you have to actually do these steps first, BEFORE getting more points.

1️⃣ Look at your current bills and see what you spend the most money on.

2️⃣ Get a credit card sign up bonus for a credit card that has a multiplier in that spending category.

(Ex: I use my Amex Gold for food because I get 4x Restaurants, 4x U.S. Supermarkets, $10 monthly Grubhub food credits, and $10 monthly Uber Eats food credits. I would not use my Amex Plat card because this card only earns 1x at Restaurants and 1x at Supermarkets)

3️⃣ Make the spending requirement to get the sign up bonus. 

4️⃣ Use the points to travel

Now how the heck can you learn what credit card to even get?

Comment “MASTERLIST” below and I’ll send you a master list of different credit cards to consider, so you can work on getting more credit card points THIS WEEK! 

Ps - This is how I travel at least once a month this past year! I use different credit cards for different purchases (based on the spending category) to get more points! And I also take advantage of credit card sign up bonuses!

I also do not use my credit card points as statement credit to pay for travel, since I usually get more value out of transfer partners.

Please note, I do not recommend anyone to get into travel hacking if you are not financially responsible and do not pay your bills on time. This hobby can potentially put you in debt.

I calculated the numbers and so far I saved over $40,000 from travel hacking this year! (and I did not save $40,000 for years to get here in my travel fund either).

And for full transparency most of my travel budget is not from having a devoted savings account either. Instead it is fun from travel hacking!

TRAVEL HACKING. I took advantage of credit card sign up offers and used the points to pay for my trips! And no I did not spend extra money to reach these credit card sign up bonuses.

You do not need to spend extra money to make a credit sign up bonus.

Instead you need to time your sign up bonuses when you have big purchases, so you can take advantage of  the sign up bonuses. This year I was able to make a few sign up bonuses because I had big purchases and I also had friends/family members pay me back after I charged my credit card for their purchases. They just sent me a Venmo or paid me in cash back!

And none of these trips were booked with a bank travel portal either! I used my credit card points to transfer out points to transfer partners to pay for most of my trips. Some were booked directly with the airline and hotel, since I already had points in that program!

Transfer partners are key to travel hacking because you usually get more value. Some of my highest redemptions have been 10 cents per point, meanwhile the bank portal can be at set rate at 1 cent per point, which isn’t usually the best value.

Now how the heck can you learn about transfer partners?

WAIT, IS THIS FOR REAL?! 🤯

I know it feels too good to be true, but I promise it’s not. 🫶🏼

I saved over 106,000 points from not using the bank portal to book this United Polaris business class seat from TPE-SFO! 106,394 points to be exact!

The exact flight from Taipei, Taiwan to San Francisco, California  was $2,721 or 181,394 points in the bank portal or 75,000 points + $114 CAD ($82.98 USD) by using Air Canada Aeroplan!

So how in the world did I do this?! 🤯

No, it was not by using the bank portal!

It’s a very simple process, to be honest!

1️⃣ Go on Google Flights to find the flight you want
2️⃣ Check if there is availability with a transfer partner
3️⃣ Transfer your bank points to the transfer partner if you find an airline seat with points
4️⃣ Pay for the flight with your points (once they transferred over) and the taxes with your credit card

A lot of banks have transfer partners, which you can use (if you find availability) to book the exact same flight! Most of the time it is cheaper than using the bank portal. 💰

Sounds too good to be true, huh? But I promise it’s not. 😉

33 years have flown by, so let’s talk about #howIgothere

13: Apartment complex caught on fire, pretty much lost everything 

14: Got my first job working at the City Hall as an Intern

15: Quit the swim team after my coach bullied me in front of everyone and told me to choose between being on the swim team or to do other extracurriculars that conflicted with practice

16: Wrote for the high school yearbook and newspaper and made the highest amount of sales for both

19: Lived in a Berkeley co-op for 2 years with 56 people to save on money and food

22:  Studied Abroad in Rome after getting free housing, free tuition, and $7,000 in spending money

23: Made the biggest financial mistake of my life and took my first “adult” job offer in advertising instead of applying around, since I was scared of not getting a job and benefits. Got paid only $35K

24-25: Was too scared to leave advertising, since I did not have enough money in savings (since I got paid so little for years) and took bad advice from others to “pay my dues”

26: Finally quit advertising and did a coding and cyber security bootcamp

27: Got a consulting tech job offer while I was still in bootcamp

28: Got recruited by other companies and picked the job offer that allowed me to work remote and pretty much unlimited PTO

29: Got featured on Today Show after one of the editors liked my reply in a Facebook Group and told me to start a blog

30: Finally moved out of my NYC apartment that I paid $650 to live in for years that had cockroaches and mice, since I was done paying my college loans

31: Moved back to LA. Never imagined myself living near the beach, since I grew up in suburbs 

32: Spoke at Frequent Traveler University, Chicago Seminars, and Travel & Adventure Show about #travelhacking

33: Made more money in my travel “side hustle” than my “full time” advertising jobs ever paid me for

#Stopsettling You were made for more. My biggest mistakes in life were taking jobs that paid me so little, overworked me, and did not let me work remote. Now I pretty much can expense travel and work anywhere I want.

You deserve to live a life you LOVE, no matter where you came from. Don’t forget that. ❤️

Here it is...⬇️

Travel hacking = taking advantage of the current rules in place from banks, airlines, and hotels to travel for less. A huge part of travel hacking is using points from credit card sign up bonuses to pay for travel!

And no I’m not talking about having a devoted savings account where you have to save for YEARS to travel but instead get your travel budget in 90 DAYS!

In travel hacking you usually have a time frame of 90 days to spend a certain amount of money (depending on the credit card) and if you meet the spending amount required you can get the huge sign up bonus. Use the huge sign up bonus to pay for your hotel and flight!

This is TRAVEL HACKING. I took advantage of credit card sign up offers and used the points to pay for my trips! And no I did not spend extra money to reach these credit card sign up bonuses.

You do not need to spend extra money to make a credit sign up bonus.

Instead you need to time your sign up bonuses when you have big purchases, so you can take advantage of the sign up bonuses. This year I was able to make a few sign up bonuses because I had big purchases and I also had friends/family members pay me back after I charged my credit card for their purchases. They just sent me a Venmo or paid me in cash back!

Now how the heck can you learn what credit card to even get?

Comment “MASTERLIST” below and I’ll send you a master list of different credit cards to consider, so you can work on getting more credit card points THIS WEEK!

Ps - This is how I travel at least once a month this past year! I use different credit cards for different purchases (based on the spending category) to get more points! And I also take advantage of credit card sign up bonuses!

I also do not use my credit card points as statement credit to pay for travel, since I usually get more value out of transfer partners.

Please note, I do not recommend anyone to get into travel hacking if you are not financially responsible and do not pay your bills on time. This hobby can potentially put you in debt.

#sorrynotsorry but if you don’t have enough credit card points or cash you can’t expect your friend with points to pay for the trip! And luckily some travel programs let you pool points, so you can easily split the costs of the trip!

Just because someone travel hacked a trip does not mean you get to take advantage of them. They spent time researching, time, and money getting that credit card sign up bonus and deal!

You have to contribute somehow to the trip, whether it be for the Uber, meals, or something you can agree mutually on to make things fair.

Luckily credit card points can help you offset travel costs! And depending on the credit card, you can pool points with a friend or someone in your household easily! So yes, you can easily split the cost of the trip with a friend.

And it is easier than you think! Look at your existing expenses and see if you can prepay anything in advance to meet the sign up bonus deadline (most are within 90 days).

Once you meet the sign up bonus spending requirement you will usually get the points/miles  within 1 - 2 statement cycles.

If you have big expenses or spend at least $1,334 in expenses each month then you can be a good candidate for travel hacking.  Most credit card sign up bonuses require at least $4,000 in spending in 3 months (hence spending at least $1,334 each month).

In the past, I have prepaid expenses and had friends Venmo me back for expenses, so I can make a sign up bonus. So, get creative here and ask around!

My journey to traveling for pennies on the dollar ⬇️

13: Apartment complex caught on fire, pretty much lost everything

14: Got my first job working at the City Hall as an Intern

15: Quit the swim team after my coach bullied me in front of everyone and told me to choose between being on the swim team or to do other extracurriculars that conflicted with practice

16: Wrote for the high school yearbook and newspaper and made the highest amount of sales for both

19: Lived in a Berkeley co-op for 2 years with 56 people to save on money and food

22: Studied Abroad in Rome after getting free housing, free tuition, and $7,000 in spending money

23: Made the biggest financial mistake of my life and took my first “adult” job offer in advertising instead of applying around, since I was scared of not getting a job and benefits. Got paid only $35K

24-25: Was too scared to leave advertising, since I did not have enough money in savings (since I got paid so little for years) and took bad advice from others to “pay my dues”

26: Finally quit advertising and did a coding and cyber security bootcamp

27: Got a consulting tech job offer while I was still in bootcamp

28: Got recruited by other companies and picked the job offer that allowed me to work remote and pretty much unlimited PTO

29: Got featured on Today Show after one of the editors liked my reply in a Facebook Group and told me to start a blog

30: Finally moved out of my NYC apartment that I paid $650 to live in for years that had cockroaches and mice, since I was done paying my college loans

31: Moved back to LA. Never imagined myself living near the beach, since I grew up in suburbs

32: Spoke at Frequent Traveler University, Chicago Seminars, and Travel & Adventure Show about #travelhacking

33: Made more money in my travel “side hustle” than my “full time” advertising jobs ever paid me for

#Stopsettling You were made for more. My biggest mistakes in life were taking jobs that paid me so little, overworked me, and did not let me work remote. Now I pretty much can expense travel and work anywhere I want.

You deserve to live a life you LOVE, no matter where you came from. Don’t forget that❤️

✅ Put that credit card on autopay! We all forget to pay things sometimes! Credit cards have high APR, and we want to make and save money off the credit card not put ourselves in debt!

✅ Call the credit card company (phone number on the back of your credit card) to confirm the sign up bonus deadline and make a calendar invite to yourself, so you don’t forget the deadline! Your sign up bonus deadline is your chance to get a lot of points (that you can use to pay for travel later) and depending on the credit card it can be 3-6 months for the deadline. You have to make the spending requirement before the sign up bonus deadline.

✅ Add your credit card to card linked programs/apps like Drop. If you shop at eligible stores, and your credit card is linked you can get rewards for that app that you can use to cash out for gift cards/cash back! This is stacking on top of your credit card points!

Do this instead...

1. Be mindful of 5/24 rule. This is a blue bank rule. You will not be approved for a credit card if you applied to 5 or more credit cards in the past 24 months. In theory, you applied to 4 personal credit cards in the past 24 months. TD, Capital One, and Discover credit cards count towards 5/24.

2. Be mindful of the 2/30 rule. This is a blue bank rule. This means 2 blue bank card approvals per 30 days. If you apply for a 3rd card you will most likely be rejected.

3. 48 month rule. This is a blue bank rule. You cannot receive another  Sapphire sign-up bonus if you’ve already received a bonus from either the (Preferred or Reserve) within the last 48 months you got the bonus.

I recommend applying to business cards before personal cards due to 5/24! Business blue bank cards do not count towards 5/24! There are a few good 90K-100K blue bank cards that you can consider right now that you can use towards travel!

And if you are ready to apply for blue bank card..

Everybody wants to save credit card points and to travel more …

But here’s the thing, in order to have save more points, you have to actually start looking at transfer partners.

Using the bank portal to book your flight isn’t always the best deal!

A lot of banks have transfer partners, which you can use (if you find availability) to book the exact same flight! Most of the time it is cheaper than using the bank portal. 💰

For example, on a flight from Toronto (YYZ) to Florence (FLR) the  Air France/KLM Flying Blue business class seat was either $5,853, 390,181 points in the bank portal or 13,500 miles + $239.21 Euros/ $260.94 USD.

So yes, if you never checked the Flying Blue transfer partner you could have easily overpaid 376,681 credit card points by using the portal for the exact same flight!

First it’ll be finding the flight, THEN comparing the bank portal rate, and then comparing the transfer partners . BUT YOU HAVE TO ACTUALLY START IN ORDER TO SEE THE SAVINGS IN POINTS!

Don’t be afraid to be bad at something before you’re a pro at it. ❤️

Every. Single. Person. You look up to started from zero. Including me.

Don’t forget that! 😉

HERE’S THE SECRET INGREDIENT…

There isn’t one. 🫶🏼
There’s no secret ingredient.
There’s no “one thing” that will make you successful.

Travel hacking is constantly evolving. There are mistake fares, limited deals, and constant changes to different credit card and award programs.

And believe me, I fell for that for YEARS, so I get it. Our brain wants a quick fix. But that just isn’t the case. 🫶🏼

So what did I ACTUALLY do to be successful at travel hacking and getting the most value out of my points?!

I was consistent. I consistently showed up and did research.. Consistently pivoted. Consistently made mistakes and learned from them.

Then I followed these steps below, and made the decision I wasn’t going to give up, no matter what. 🫶🏼

1️⃣ Read and listen to different travel hacking blogs, social media, and podcasts. I also have a podcast at @bougieinabackpack :). It is good to get different perspectives from people on how to do things. Some people are budget and some people are luxury. There is nothing wrong with either because you are saving money.

2️⃣ Sign up for credit cards. You can consume all the travel hacking content that you want, but if you don’t actually sign up for the credit cards and use their benefits and points then how do you expect to learn?

3️⃣ Be responsible with travel hacking. Pay all your bills on time and treat your credit card like a debit card.

4️⃣ Use the points on the card to pay for travel! The best award redemption is the one that is most relevant to you! Some people travel hack Disney, some travel hack overwater villas, and some fly business class. Do the trip that you want!

Here’s the deal… ↓

You can travel however you want, but it is good to also be realistic at the same time. How many trips do you want to go in a year? Do you have enough budget to pay more?

I fly business, first, economy, and basic economy! Sometimes I just want a cheap vacation, and I do not care if Spirit takes me there if I cannot find a lie flat seat!

Here are some of my travel hacks that I am not giving up in 2024 ⬇️.

→ Connecting flight vs nonstop. Sometimes I will take a connection flight because it is cheaper and there is an airport lounge! So, if I can squeeze in dinner time or lunch time then why not??

→ Red eye flights. Taking a flight at 8pm and landing at 5am. I do this pretty often because I want to avoid paying for a hotel room. #sorrynotsorry but taking a red eye flight is cheaper sometimes than a flight during the daytime and I don’t have to pay $100+ for a hotel night.

→ Seat assignment fees. I will risk putting myself in a middle seat because I do not want to pay for that seat assignment fee. Most of the times I have waited until the last minute to check in and have been lucky enough to not get a middle seat. Depending on the flight it can range from $25-100 for seat assignment fees.

My point here? Create a travel plan that works for your needs and budget.

Here it is...⬇️

Travel hacking = taking advantage of the current rules in place from banks, airlines, and hotels to travel for less. A huge part of travel hacking is using points from credit card sign up bonuses to pay for travel!

And no I’m not talking about having a devoted savings account where you have to save for YEARS to travel but instead get your travel budget in 90 DAYS!

In travel hacking you usually have a time frame of 90 days to spend a certain amount of money (depending on the credit card) and if you meet the spending amount required you can get the huge sign up bonus. Use the huge sign up bonus to pay for your hotel and flight!

This is TRAVEL HACKING. I took advantage of credit card sign up offers and used the points to pay for my trips! And no I did not spend extra money to reach these credit card sign up bonuses.

You do not need to spend extra money to make a credit sign up bonus.

Instead you need to time your sign up bonuses when you have big purchases, so you can take advantage of the sign up bonuses. This year I was able to make a few sign up bonuses because I had big purchases and I also had friends/family members pay me back after I charged my credit card for their purchases. They just sent me a Venmo or paid me in cash back!

Now how the heck can you learn what credit card to even get?

Comment “MASTERLIST” below and I’ll send you a master list of different credit cards to consider, so you can work on getting more credit card points THIS WEEK!

Ps - This is how I travel at least once a month this past year! I use different credit cards for different purchases (based on the spending category) to get more points! And I also take advantage of credit card sign up bonuses!

I also do not use my credit card points as statement credit to pay for travel, since I usually get more value out of transfer partners.

Please note, I do not recommend anyone to get into travel hacking if you are not financially responsible and do not pay your bills on time. This hobby can potentially put you in debt.

GRWM for  a day in the life of a travel hacker ⬇️. This is what it’s like traveling with a travel hacker!

As travel hacker we usually find the cheapest way to get to the airport and sometimes it is using public transit or Uber credits.

We usually skip lines at the airport and use Clear/TSA PreCheck but unfortunately, sometimes it is closed! This is at Denver International Airport, and this was my first time actually going to an airport in the USA with a long line due to Clear/TSA PreCheck being closed. Most of the time when I fly out of LAX, SFO, and JFK I usually skip the lines pretty quick, so this was new to me at DEN!

Then we go to the airport lounge at the airport to grab food/drinks before the flight.

FYI the Amex Plat card has all these credits mentioned Uber, Clear, TSA Precheck/Global Entry, and airport lounge access. It is the card I keep in my wallet whenever I travel, since I also get 5x on airlines and airport lounge access. For a $695 Annual Fee card I actually make $792 off this card.

Do you also take red eye flights to maximize time and to save money? I usually can sleep on airplanes easily, so if I see a red eye option I will usually take it to avoid paying for a hotel room!

I factor in costs between paying extra for a hotel room for the night and also spending time flying vs having fun in my destination.

In the past, hotels have even let me check in early at 8am without paying extra! Of course your results may vary, but some hotels (especially the bigger hotel chains) will let you check in early without issues if they have a room available. You can always leave your bags at the front desk or with the bellman and go explore as well.

I have taken red eye flights with flights I booked with #creditcard points to fly first/business and even #budgetairlines like Frontier and Spirit! So yes, sometimes you find me dead asleep on a #787 in a lie flat bed or even on an Airbus A320!

Here ⬇️ are steps on how to apply as a #soleproprietor.

1) Your business name is your own name. For example, if your name is David John Smith on your personal #creditcards then you can put David John Smith as your name and put David John Smith as your Business name. If you do not have a middle name, and you name is David Smith, then it would be David Smith as your name and David Smith as your Business Name.

2)Your Tax ID Number is your Social Security Number

3) Your business income is the amount you will be earning/estimating from your side income

Do not make up a business name. If you do it can void your application.

If you are delayed due to weather, and stuck somewhere for 12+ hours and/or if you stay overnight please ⬇️ check your credit card if it has trip delay.

A lot of credit cards 💳 have built in travel protections, which is helpful  if you are stranded somewhere!

Comment “tripdelay” or DM me for a sample list of #creditcards that have trip delay insurance.These annual #creditcard fees range from $95-$695. The sign up bonuses also range from 30,000-150,000 points.

Depending on the credit card, trip delay protection will kick in if a common carrier (bus, cruise trip, airplane, and train) delays you by more than 6 hours -12 hours or if you have to stay overnight. The trip has to be for a city away from your residence and less than 365 days in length. Trip delay insurance will help cover expenses while you wait. Expenses include food, transportation, overnight accommodation, toiletries, and medication.

Please note, trip delay insurance will not work if you oversleep or get stuck in traffic.

Please read the fine print for details for your credit card coverage. Coverage is usually up to $500 per covered trip and up to two claims per 12-month period per card. Coverage can only extend to the people traveling with you like your spouse, and dependent children up to age 19 or 26 if full time student.

Please note, coverage is only provided on round-trip travel purchased entirely with that eligible card (paying taxes and fees on award tickets should count) for Amex vs blue bank you can book one way. Trip delay coverage from your credit card will kick in after you use up your frequent flyer/third party insurance. To file a claim call your credit card.

This ⬇️ is a great tool to use if you don’t know how to transfer out your credit card points to book flights.

The @pointme tool makes things super easy for me to understand where to transfer my credit card points out to. I transfer out my credit card points 90% of the time, since I usually get more value this way!

The major banks American Express, Capital One, Citi, and blue bank all have transfer partners. The point.me tool tells you which bank and which transfer partner to use to book your flight!

Your bank portal is usually a set range from 1 cent to 1.5 cents per point (depending on your credit card) meanwhile if you use a transfer partner it can usually range. I have gotten redemptions as high as 7 cents per point for flights just by transferring out my points. I usually aim to have higher than 1.5 cents per point when transferring out my points.

As seen here I have a variety of options. If I’m using my credit card points I could have transferred 21,000 Citi Points to Qantas Frequent Flyer or 20,500 American Express points transferred to Qantas to book.

I just need to make a free Qantas Frequent Flyer account and use that account number and link it to Citi or American Express. Once linked I can then transfer points from Amex or Citi to Qantas to book.

This is helpful if you don’t have the 12,500 Alaska miles to book this flight. The flight was $393, so you would be getting at least 1.9 cents if you transfer them out.

Point.me also tells you if there are transfer bonuses, so you save money and points!
